nodes.bodyText: Can we not have this section until ready?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+# Configure TLS Protocol Version and Ciphers
+
+## SDK
+### How to configure TLS version
+Use `jdk.tls.client.protocols` system property to enforce TLS version. This property was introduced to JDK7 `7u95` and to JDK6 `6u121`.
+```
+$ java -Djdk.tls.client.protocols="TLSv1.2" yourApp
+```
+
+### How to configure TLS ciphers
+Use `jdk.tls.legacyAlgorithms` property of `java.security` file to enforce ciphers.
+On JDK 8 and earlier, `java.security` file is under folder `%JAVA_HOME%/lib/security`, for JDK 9, it’s  under folder `%JAVA_HOME%/conf/security`
+
+## Android
+To be done
+

@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@

+## SDK
+### How to configure TLS version
+Use `jdk.tls.client.protocols` system property to enforce TLS version. This property was introduced to JDK7 `7u95` and to JDK6 `6u121`.
+```
+$ java -Djdk.tls.client.protocols="TLSv1.2" yourApp
+```
+
+### How to configure TLS ciphers
+Use `jdk.tls.legacyAlgorithms` property of `java.security` file to enforce ciphers.
+On JDK 8 and earlier, `java.security` file is under folder `%JAVA_HOME%/lib/security`, for JDK 9, it’s  under folder `%JAVA_HOME%/conf/security`
+
+## Android
+To be done
+

nodes.bodyText: Suggest using 2 asterisks (bold) instead of backticks (commands) for things like jdk.tls.client.protocols and 7u95 that aren't commands.

nodes.bodyText: I recommend installing a markdown linter. It'll tell you to put newlines around headers.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+# Configure TLS Protocol Version and Ciphers
+
+## SDK

nodes.bodyText:
Can we say explicitly to use TLS 1.2 somewhere? like it is said in other SDK's?
So, to be sure your .NET code is using TLS1.2, you should configure your operating system to use TLS1.2 and disable TLS1.0 and TLS 1.1.
